newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Duisenberg favours money supply target for ECB.
newsitem.headline: Duisenberg favours money supply target for ECB.

text.p: Dutch central bank president Wim Duisenberg told Reuters Financial Television on Tuesday he favoured a money supply growth target as the main target variable for the European Central Bank's monetary policy.

Duisenberg will take over as head of the European Monetary Institute in July and is regarded as a strong candidate to become the first president of the ECB which will supervise the planned launch of the single European currency in 1999.

In an RFTV interview, Duisenberg said that in practice most countries monitored several variables even if they were mainly committed to a money growth target -- such as Germany -- or a direct inflation target -- such as Britain.
The ECB should also monitor a broad range of economic indicators, Duisenberg said, adding that for the sake of clarity he would like special emphasis to be given to the money supply.

"What we do want as a future European Central Bank is to make the policy as understandable and transparent and predictable to the public at large as possible...Starting from those criteria I personally have a slight preference for following a money supply target policy," he said.
